title: How do I play Thresh ADC?

replies.body: You don't. Your autoattack steroid involves not autoattacking for a while because it's actually a poke tool and not a steroid, your Q stops your autoattack, and you have no AD scaling. And every time ADC Thresh sort of almost works, Riot nerfs it.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2Ob0mjGP,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-04-30T07:06:52.130+0000)
>
> You don't. Your autoattack steroid involves not autoattacking for a while because it's actually a poke tool and not a steroid, your Q stops your autoattack, and you have no AD scaling. And every time ADC Thresh sort of almost works, Riot nerfs it.

^ This right here
I've seen {{champion:412}} players do well with {{item:3087}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3095}} because of his e passive.

Get a duo. Offmeta makes a lot of players tilt and not play their best.
I've played with and against Thresh ADC and it's pretty bonkers once they get {{item:3085}}. So much stick and tank.

Get a tank support
Max e and wait for it to go red then smack the enemies with dark harvest
Get firecannon ie duskblade and then whatever you want.
Lose the game because everyone else is feeding and you fall 2 shot but then realise it was worth it because you had a lot of fun.

You don't. If you really must do it try picking against AD heavy teams such as Talon/Zed mid. Death's Dance's Omnivamp works with your on hit damage. For crit items you can go Cannon for fully charged E poke, or Hurrican for AoE dps.
